## About {#modal-about-title}
</header>

:::: {#modal-about-content}
This map shows how a set of climate models estimate 35Â°C+ days will change across Australia in the coming decades. You can narrow in on a particular postcode.

The data comes from [NARCliM1.5](https://doi.org/10.1029/2020EF001833), an experiment undertaking by the [NSW Department of Planning and Environment](https://www.dpie.nsw.gov.au) and the [Climate Change Research Centre](https://ccrc.unsw.edu.au).

Because more than one climate models is used, we tell you the range of estimates among them.

NARCLiM1.5 is used by scientists to compare against an earlier version of NARCliM, which had slightly less warming. **These estimates should therefore be considered an upper bound.**
